events.name: Getting Started with Kubernetes
events.description:
In 2018 Kubernetes is emerging as the de facto choice for managing containerised applications. All the big cloud providers are including it as a service and many great applications and extensions are being built on top of Kubernetes.

Agenda:
19:00 - 20:00 Introduction to Kubernetes - Basic concepts and use cases.

20:00 - 21:00 Hands on Demo

21:00 + Networking

events.name: Kubernetes Workshop 2
events.description:
We’re going to explore various solutions with Kubernetes in Google Cloud. This is going to be a hands-on session so make sure you have your laptop with you.
The labs are self paced, suitable for all levels.

Victor Gradinescu is the cofounder of Mobile Kinetics, a Mobile and Cloud Development Agency. He writes code for Android but also architects and develops cloud based solutions.

events.name: Cloud Next Extended
events.description:
We will go through in-depth summaries of some of the topics covered at Google Cloud Next '18 London. Topics will include:
- Cloud IoT Core & Cloud IoT Edge
- Kubernetes & Serverless
- BigQuery ML
- Data Engineering in Google Cloud

The speakers will be:
- Bogdan Lucaciu - Chief Technology Officer at Adore Me
- Cosmin Stefan - Co-founder and Software Engineer at Silverbit Tech
- Victor Gradinescu - Co-founder and Software Engineer at Mobile Kinetics

Please note that we will host this meetup at the Adore Me office near Cismigiu.

events.name: Spring Meetup - Containers and Serverless
events.description:
We meet again in this first meetup of the Spring to discuss two very interesting topics with two experienced engineers.

Agenda:
"Care and use of container orchestration systems" - Andrei Dragomir, Fitbit Romania

Let’s talk about why people go from “docker run” to Heroku dynos, and ways of solving this problem. We’ll talk about Mesos, Kubernetes, how container orchestration systems work, why you should use them, and especially, why you shouldn’t !
Andrei has experience with distributed systems. He worked on distributed data processing systems and migrating these services across 2 cloud providers, moving from bare metal to containerized infrastructures. Since 2017, he’s wrangling microservices @ Fitbit.

"Serving users without servers" - Felix Crisan, co-founder Netopia & MobilPay

This will be about developing serverless solutions on top of Google Cloud Functions.
When not dedicating his time to the two ventures, Felix teaches BigData concepts and technologies, including Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence algorithms.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam #1 - IoT
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for a Cloud Study Jam focusing on the IoT solutions based on Google Cloud Platform.
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want
Bring your own laptop as this will be a hands on experience. The labs will run in the browser so no additional software needs to be installed.

events.name: Application Development on Kubernetes - GDG/BJUG Joint Meetup
events.description:
It's time for another Kubernetes meetup, focused more on Application Development. This is a joint meetup with our friends from Bucharest Java User Group

Agenda:

- Ana-Maria Mihalceanu - Kubernetes and the 12 factors cloud applications
The 12-factor app methodology (https://12factor.net) represents a best practice when comes to cloud application development and for the past years many developers employ it in order to facilitate both their current and future work. Kubernetes, with its cloud-agnostic container deployments, complements the 12 factors apps with their flavors across frameworks and cloud providers. This presentation is intended for all those curious on how to manipulate their code and Kubernetes as well in its use as a developer but also as operational. Each of the principles will be illustrated by a demo.

Ana-Maria is a custom application development enthusiast, co-founder of Bucharest Software Craftsmanship Community and a constant adopter of challenging technical scenarios. In 2016, as tech passionate of cloud application development she achieved IBM Certified Application Developer - Cloud Platform v1. Since then, she has enriched her cloud expertise by learning and certifying as a Salesforce Developer and attained a better understanding on how to integrate different types of cloud offerings. Other passions? The knowledge hunt through reading and growing fashion skills through shopping.

- Bogdan Lucaciu - CI on GKE for a large scale microservice-based website (selling sexy lingerie)

"I’m a professional hat balancer: coder, entrepreneur, sysadmin, builder, leader, coach, certified barista and CTO. My core values are freedom, contribution and curiosity. I’m running the geek squad of Adore Me, a disruptive lingerie brand and one of the fastest growing retailers in the United States. My mantra: embrace change, continuously adapt and transform the business through technology." (Bogdan)

events.name: DevFest Bucharest 2019
events.description:
Details
We’re excited to announce DevFest Bucharest 2019!

This is a community-run, one-day conference aimed to bring developers, tech-companies, students and awesome speakers together in one location, so they can learn and share knowledge about established or emerging technologies on topics such as Cloud, Kubernetes, Big Data, Data science, Android, Flutter, Firebase, Mobile Technologies, Google Assistant, Machine Learning, Kotlin and more.

At GDG DevFest Bucharest 2019 our tracks will be: Android & Mobile Technologies, Kotlin/Everywhere and Cloud Technologies.

Read more and grab your tickets on: https://devfest.ro

GDG DevFest Bucharest is a community event, made by the community for the community. The main purpose of this conference is to bring together tech specialists and give to the attendees the possibility to participate in their presentations and ask them questions about their common passions: technology and programming.

events.name: Online Speedrun Challenge: BigQuery, Kubernetes, ML and Cloud Run
events.description:
Hello!

We’re sure most of you have learning new technologies and tools as New Year’s resolutions. That’s why we’re excited to participate in the the first Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe. And as part of the GDG Cloud Bucharest, you’re among the first to know about this!!

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you’ll have the opportunity to join four Speedruns and get hands-on experience with tools like Kubernetes, Assistant, BigQuery our Cloud Run, Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

Find more information and register here: bit.ly/speedrunchallenge0220

Schedule:
Speedrun Start Dates: February 3, 10, 17 and 24
Webinar Time: Mondays from 7pm to 9pm (GMT+1)
Topics
BigQuery Basics for Data Analysts
Kubernetes in the Google Cloud
Google Developer Essentials
Hello Cloud Run.

events.name: Community Speedrun Challenge
events.description:
Especially in these times, we’re sure most of you are interested in learning new technologies and tools. That’s why we’re excited to participate in the Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe. And as part of the GDG Cloud Bucharest community, you’re among the first to know about this!

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in May where you’ll have the opportunity to join four Speedruns and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning on Google Cloud, and take your first steps with tools like BigQuery, Cloud Speech API, and Cloud ML Engine. Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

Each Speedrun kicks off with a Webinar by a Google trainer [masked]). The Speedrun is open until Sunday the same week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time.

Find more information and the registration here:
https://bit.ly/speedrunchallengeeurope

Schedule:
Speedrun Start Dates: May 4, 11, 18, and 25
Webinar Time: Mondays from 20:00 to 22:00

Topics:
Baseline: Data, ML, AI with Zack Akil (Google)
Intro to ML: Language Processing with Dale Markowitz (Google)
Intermediate ML with Lee Boonstra (Google)
BigQuery for Machine Learning with Felipe Hoffa (Google)

organizers.name: Victor G.
organizers.bio: I am a co-organiser of GDG Bucharest and have been involved in the tech community for over four years. In 2011 I co-founded Mobile Kinetics where my team focuses on native mobile applications on all major platforms, consumer or enterprise oriented.

group_profile.intro: Founder of Mobile Kinetics - a mobile & cloud development agency.
